content:
BatchClient BatchClient Class

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.Azure.Batch
Assembly:
Azure.Batch.dll

A client for an Azure Batch account, used to access the Batch service.

Edit

In this Article

CustomBehaviors CustomBehaviors

Edit

Gets or sets a list of behaviors that modify or customize requests to the Batch service.

public IList<BatchClientBehavior> CustomBehaviors { get; set; }Public Property CustomBehaviors As IList(Of BatchClientBehavior)
Value
IList<BatchClientBehavior> IList(Of BatchClientBehavior)

Remarks

These behaviors are inherited by child objects.

Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

Methods

Close() Close()

Edit

Closes the current instance of BatchClient.
Closed instances of BatchClient are unable to make calls to the Batch Service and the behavior and values of any other methods or properties are undefined. These restrictions also apply immediately to any objects that can trace instantation back to this BatchClient. This method is threadsafe and can be called any number of times.

public void Close()Public Sub Close

CloseAsync() CloseAsync()

Edit

Starts an asynchronous operation to close the current instance of BatchClient.
Closed instances of BatchClient are unable to make calls to the Batch Service and the behavior and values of any other methods or properties are undefined. These restrictions also apply immediately to any objects that can trace instantation back to this BatchClient. This method is threadsafe and can be called any number of times.

public Task CloseAsync()Public Function CloseAsync As Task
Returns
Task Task

A Task object that represents the asynchronous operation.

Dispose() Dispose()

Edit

Calls Close() and releases the unmanaged resources and disposes of the managed resources used by the BatchClient.

public void Dispose()Public Sub Dispose

Dispose(Boolean) Dispose(Boolean)

Edit

Releases unmanaged resources used by the BatchClient, and optionally disposes of managed resources.

protected virtual void Dispose(bool disposing)Protected Overridable Sub Dispose(disposing As Boolean)
Parameters
disposing
Boolean Boolean

Indicates whether the object is being disposed or finalized. If true, the object is being disposed and can dispose managed resource. If false, the object is being finalized and should only release unmanaged resources.

Open(BatchServiceClient) Open(BatchServiceClient)

Edit

Blocking call that creates an instance of BatchClient associated with the specified BatchServiceClient.

Parameters
restClient
BatchServiceClient BatchServiceClient

The instance of BatchServiceClient to use for all calls made to the Batch Service. It will not be disposed when BatchClient is disposed.

Returns

An instance of BatchServiceClient.
